alert.note: Alert for Middle Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 09 at 10:01AM AKDT until June 09 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY FROM THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER NORTH... * Winds...North 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 20 percent. * Temperatures...In the mid 60s. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected from 2 pm to 10 pm today. * Location...Middle Kuskokwim Valley from the Kuskokwim River north. This includes areas north of Aniak, Chuathbaluk, Crooked Creek, Red Devil, Sleetmute and Stony River. * Impacts...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public. -CJ
